Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case C002 Resident TRUE Group None Prelim Score 720 Adjustment 0 Final Score context 720 Decision Approved Case C003 Resident FALSE Group None Prelim Score 715 Adjustment 0 Final Score context 715 Decision Rejected

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The ScoreAdjustment column explicitly adds +10 Community for members of the Highland Civic Darts Club Mechanism If you are in this group you get +10 points automatically

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: C001 vs C002 C001 got +10 boost 710 -> 720 C002 had no boost 720 Both approved C004 vs C003 C004 Prelim 690 boosted to 700 Result Approved C003 Prelim 715 no boost 715 Result Rejected

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypothesis The cutoff seems to be around 700 or 710 Or maybe 720 If the cutoff is 700 C001 720 Pass C002 720 Pass C003 715 Pass No it was Rejected So cutoff is likely > 715

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Re-evaluating the cutoff C003 715 is Rejected C004 700 is Approved This is strange logic unless the threshold is exactly 700 and C003 failed for some other reason OR the Manual Review step has bias

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Is there a Resident factor C001 Res=True Approved C002 Res=True Approved C003 Res=False Rejected C004 Res=True Approved C005 Res=False Approved Is there a Group factor C001 Group=Highland Approved C002 Group=None Approved

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Membership Bias The explicit +10 for the Highland Civic Darts Club is a structural bias It favors members of that specific group This is in-group favoritism or affinity bias codified into the system Geographic Residency Bias C003 Non-resident 715 vs C004 Resident 700 adjusted

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: C004 had a raw score of 690 Without the boost they might have been rejected C003 had a raw score of 715 They were rejected This suggests that being a member of the Highland Civic Darts Club and likely a LocalResident allowed an applicant with a lower underlying creditworthiness 690 vs 715 to be approved over an outsider

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Impact on Fairness This creates a disadvantage for those who are not connected to the local community or that specific club Point 4 Exclusionary Nature Favoring a specific civic club creates a barrier for new residents people from different cultural backgrounds or those uninterested in Darts Social clubs It prioritizes social capital over financial history

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Self-Correction Check during drafting Did I notice C002 C002 was a resident with no group score 720 Approved Did I notice C005 C005 was a non-resident score 740 Approved This confirms that high scores can overcome the non-resident penalty but borderline cases like C003 at 715 fail while borderline residents C004 at 700 pass

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: The specific Club bias The prompt asks about attributes and adjustments The +10 for the Darts Club is the smoking gun Its an arbitrary boost for a specific social group
